ud5.6:18.1: The Vinaya version of this passage omits “sixteen” (Kd 5:13.9.5). | Sarena abhaṇi (“intoned”) means “recited with tones”, apparently a reference to a chanting style that made use of or echoed the Vedic tonal system (svara). It was allowed for mendicants at Kd 15:3.2.3; see too Kd 22:1.10.4. Contrast gītassara (“singing sound”, AN 5.209), which is not allowed as it is a sensuous song (DN 21:1.6.2).
